intro: Gaylussacia brasiliensis var. subevenia, commonly known as the Brazilian huckleberry, is a shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically red or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its dense foliage and seasonal flowering.
